1.instruction:
1. Upgrade Interview System from .NET 6 to .NET 9:
- Update project file and dependencies
- Test and fix any compatibility issues

2. Add Docker support:
- Create a Dockerfile using .NET 9 SDK alpine base image for build
- Use .NET 9 runtime alpine for the final image
- Include multi-stage build to minimize image size
- Add docker-compose.yml for easy deployment
- Update README.md with Docker instructions

Project location: /data/chats/4bb7y/workspace
GitHub repository: https://github.com/pasayazici/mgx-interview

After completion:
1. Test the Docker build locally
2. Update the repository with new changes
3. Document the changes in README.md including:
   - .NET 9 upgrade notes
   - Docker build and run instructions

2.instruction:
Add test data seeding and security logging to the Interview System Admin Panel:

1. Test Data Seeding:
- Create seed data for initial admin user
- Add seed data for test companies
- Add seed data for test interviews
- Add seed data for test candidates
- Implement a seeding mechanism that can be triggered via command

2. Security Logging with Serilog:
- Implement Serilog for structured logging
- Log all security events (login attempts, authorization failures)
- Log all critical operations (user creation, role changes)
- Log all API access attempts
- Implement log rotation and retention policies
- Add log filtering and categorization

Use the existing implementation at /InterviewSystem/ and ensure proper integration with SQLite database.

3.instruction:
Set up Git repository and deploy the Interview System Admin Panel:

1. Initialize Git repository:
- Create a new repository in workspace directory
- Add .gitignore for .NET projects
- Initialize the repository
- Add and commit all project files
- Create a new GitHub repository
- Push the code to GitHub

2. Configure and deploy the application:
- Ensure all migrations and seeding works
- Test the application locally
- Update README.md with setup instructions

3. Provide repository and access details:
- GitHub repository URL
- Local setup instructions
- Default admin credentials

Make sure the repository is public and accessible for cloning.

1.instruction: Create and write comprehensive test cases and scenarios in a test plan document

2.instruction: Write and execute automated test scripts for the identified test scenarios

3.instruction: Generate a detailed test execution report with results and findings
